NAME: Kutiyattam, Sanskrit theatre
DESCRIPTION: Koodiyattam or Kutiyattam is performed by Chakyar and Nangyaramma castes of Kerala. It is a performing art that dates back to Sangam era.

NAME: Tradition of Vedic chanting
DESCRIPTION: Vedic chanting is chanting of Sanskrit mantras or pathas. It is also a part of Sanskrit or Vedic study memorization.

NAME: Ramlila, the traditional performance of the Ramayana
DESCRIPTION: It is a re-enactment of God Rama's life according to Ramayana.

NAME: Ramman, religious festival and ritual theatre of the Garhwal Himalayas, India
DESCRIPTION: It is a festival of the Garhwali people of Salur Dungra village. Not performed anywhere else in the Himalayas.

NAME: Chhau dance
DESCRIPTION: Purulia Chhau, Saraikela Chhau and Mayurbhanj Chhau are various styles of the dance.

NAME: Kalbelia folk songs and dances of Rajasthan
DESCRIPTION: Kalbeliya is a snake charming tribe. They perform dance on traditional music.

NAME: Mudiyettu, ritual theatre and dance drama of Kerala
DESCRIPTION: It is a dance drama that enacts stories and tales of a battle between Kali and Darika.

NAME: Buddhist chanting of Ladakh: recitation of sacred Buddhist texts in the trans-Himalayan Ladakh region, Jammu and Kashmir, India
DESCRIPTION: Refers to the recitation of sacred Buddhist texts mainly performed by various sects such as Kagyud, Nyngma, Geluk, and Shakya.

NAME: Sankirtana, ritual singing, drumming and dancing of Manipur
DESCRIPTION: Refers to narration of Vaishnava God Krishna's story through singing, drumming and dancing.

NAME: Traditional brass and copper craft of utensil making among the Thatheras of Jandiala Guru, Punjab, India
DESCRIPTION: Thatheras are artisan caste of Punjab who make brass and copper craft utensils.

NAME: Navroz
DESCRIPTION: Navroz in India is mainly celebrated by Parsi community.

NAME: Yoga
DESCRIPTION: Yoga is physical and spiritual practice originated in Ancient India. Every year 21 June is celebrated as International Yoga Day.

NAME: Kumbh Mela
REGION: Cities of Haridwar, Prayagraj, Trimbak-Nashik-Trimbak and Ujjain
DESCRIPTION: Kumbh Mela is held every 12 years on rotation.

NAME: Durga Puja in Kolkata
DESCRIPTION: It is a festival of worshipping of Goddess Durga.

NAME: Garba of Gujarat
DESCRIPTION: It is a form of dance and performed on festivals and occasions.
